instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power after changing palmrest
threads.message:
have i killed the PCH on this board? it had a bloated battery and the battery has been disconnected. i can power on with MagSafe 2 85w fine . so i took the board out then put in a good chassis with good battery. now it doesn't power up at all with battery nor charger.

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_PCH_VCCIO_S0</SIGNAL> has 14 ohms to ground.

on a known good board it has 33 ohms to ground on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_PCH_VCCIO_S0</SIGNAL>
8

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.57
PP3v42 - 3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BK_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.3v
the resistance between 17/18 : 4.4 ohms and 27/28 22ohms
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4v
no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: Definitely using 85 watt magsafe 2 OEM? If in doubt, check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: yes. i need a signature. i only used genuine lol

threads.message:
I've spent over an hour working on this board last night.

just then..I've tried plugging a MagSafe in this morning.
now it does fan spin
why?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: Sounds like you were trolled by bad charger or just a weird intermittent thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power after changing palmrest
threads.message: na i've two chargers on the desk. they work fine on similar board. i always like to compare measurements. you are right just a weird intermittent thing.
